title: Operational definition of serious mental illness

content.description:
Data for the graph is based on the National Survey on Drug Use and Health. Prevalence rates include individuals diagnosable or diagnosed within the past year, meeting the specified duration criteria outlined in the DSM.

Past Year Prevalence of Serious Mental Illness Amount U.S. Adults (2021)
content.question: Which of the following could be an operational definition for serious mental illness (SMI) in this national survey?

choices.label: A mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder that healthcare professionals commonly diagnose.
A mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder resulting in limits to one or more major life activities.
A mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder that may require medication for treatment.
A mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder that is highly stigmatized by society.

content.answer: A mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder resulting in limits to one or more major life activities.
